intro: Afrohybanthus enneaspermus, commonly known as the three-seeded hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant produces three seeds per fruit, which is a distinguishing feature of its species name. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
